attributes.action: insurance companies to compensate loss of earnings. early years - coronavirus
attributes.additional_details: Put in place legislation/a plan to protect the child care and early years providers from being wiped out due to lack of resources and financial aid to get us through this period of disaster.
attributes.background: Put in legislation where insurance companies must pay out for loss of earnings for a forced closure. (high risk / longer isolation evidence shown) for the covid-19 virus. We pay insurance to protect us in these events! we can go from earning a self sustaining wage to less than SSP.

rejection.details:
The decision to pay out under a policy is one for individual insurance companies, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

If you are unhappy with the decision of your insurer you should complain directly to them. 

If you are unsatisfied with how an insurer responds to your complaint you may wish to contact the financial ombudsman: https://www.financial-ombudsman.org.uk/businesses/complaints-deal/insurance

If you want the Government to give nurseries emergency funding, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301836

If you want the Government to exempt nurseries from business rates, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300210

You can find out what Government support is available for businesses as a result of the coronavirus here: https://www.businesssupport.gov.uk/

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
